channel.title: {317} Fixing Printout NULL
channel.description:
[size=14pt]I do not know if this has been posted before. I had not seen it anywhere before so I would like to share it so the community may benefit.[/size]
[b]Who likes nulls?[/b] I know I don't, and thats why i'd like to share my simple solution to the community. To save you from the frustration :P. It does not fix what causes them, no, but why it is printing out null instead of a good solid error.
[b]Step 1:[/b] open PlayerHandler.java
[b]Step 2: [/b] Go to the end of the [CODE]public void process() {[/CODE]
[b]Step 3:[/b] At the end of that void there is a line that says [CODE]misc.println(e.getMessage());[/CODE] You are seeing null because [CODE]e.getMessage()[/CODE] at least in this case, always returns null.
[b]Step 4:[/b] Replace the line with [CODE]e.printStackTrace();[/CODE] You now should see a full size error when your server is nulling, which in my opinion is pretty useful.
[b]Step 5 [OPTIONAL]:[/b] Fix those errors :D Hope this contributes and I hope you love that instead of just nulling you now know why your nulling.

item.title: {317} Fixing Printout NULL
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

Feel free to add this to the snippets thread, I’ll have to lock this as it isn’t a proper tutorial really.

item.title: {317} Fixing Printout NULL
item.dc:creator: @oniscape oniscape
item.description:
@oniscape wrote:

[size=14pt]I do not know if this has been posted before. I had not seen it anywhere before so I would like to share it so the community may benefit.[/size]

Who likes nulls?
I know I don’t, and thats why i’d like to share my simple solution to the community. To save you from the frustration :P. It does not fix what causes them, no, but why it is printing out null instead of a good solid error.

Step 1:
open PlayerHandler.java

Step 2:
Go to the end of the

public void process() {

Step 3:
At the end of that void there is a line that says

misc.println(e.getMessage());

You are seeing null because

e.getMessage()

at least in this case, always returns null.

Step 4:
Replace the line with

e.printStackTrace();

You now should see a full size error when your server is nulling, which in my opinion is pretty useful.

Step 5 [OPTIONAL]:
Fix those errors
Hope this contributes and I hope you love that instead of just nulling you now know why your nulling.

Read full topic
